global.flag: Adds support for 3dfx video cards to XFree86. See: voodoo3
Adds support for 3dnow multimedia processor instructions
Adds support for X11
Adds support of the 3d athena widget set
Enables support for decoding ATSC A/52 streams used in DVD
Enables support for MPEG-4 AAC Audio
Adds support for media-libs/aalib (ASCII-Graphics Library)
Adds support for accessibility (eg 'at-spi' library)
Adds support for Access Control Lists
Adds support for Advanced Configuration and Power Interface
Adds support for the Adabas database engine
Adds support for the adns DNS client library
Adds OpenAFS support (distributed file system)
Enable AIM IM protocol support
Adds support for media-libs/alsa-lib (Advanced Linux Sound Architecture)
Adds support for optimizations for G4 and G5/ppc970 processors
Chooses Apache1 support when a package optionally supports Apache1
Chooses Apache2 support when a package supports both Apache1 and Apache2
Adds APM (Advanced Power Management) support
Adds support for aRts: the KDE sound daemon
Adds support for libaudiofile where applicable
Adds avifile (Library for avi) support
Enable bash-completion support
Adds support for libbcmath
Adds support for sys-libs/db (Berkeley DB for MySQL)
Enables bidirectional language support
Flag to enable or disable options for prebuilt (GRP) packages (eg. due to licensing issues)
Adds support for the Birdstep Database Server
adds support for the virtual/blas numerical library
Enable Bluetooth Support
Adds beep media player support. Mainly used to support bmp plugins in xmms, though also used for generic BMP support.
Adds support for gnome-base/bonobo (Gnome CORBA interfaces)
!!internal use only!! DO NOT SET THIS FLAG YOURSELF!, used during original system bootstrapping
add bounds checking patch by Haj Ten Brugge, this will DISABLE the hardened PIE+SSP patches
!!internal use only!! DO NOT SET THIS FLAG YOURSELF!, used for creating build images and the first half of bootstrapping.
Use the bzlib compression library
Adds support for calendars (not using mcal!)
Adds support for the Canna kana to kanji conversion engine
Use Linux capabilities library to control privileges.
Adds support for the CDB database engine from the author of qmail
Copies files from the CD rather than asking the user to copy them, mostly used with games
Enables cdparanoia support
Adds support for CD writer hardware
Enable chasen support
Adds support for Multi-byte character languages (Chinese, Japanese, Korean)
Adds support for Clam AntiVirus software (usually with a plugin)
Adds support for clibpdf
Add support for encryption -- using mcrypt or gpg where applicable
Enables cscope interface -- in vim for example
Enables ctype functions
Add support for CUPS (Common Unix Printing System)
Adds support for client-side URL transfer library
Adds support for using curl in streams
Enables support for IBM DB2 database server
Enables dbm-compatible layers
Adds support for dbase file format
Adds support for generic DBM databases.
Adds support for dbmaker database server
Enable dbus support for anything that needs it (gpsd, gnomemeeting, etc)
Adds database abstraction layer
Tells configure and the makefiles to build for debugging. Effects vary across packages, but generally it will at least add -g to CFLAGS. Remember to set FEATURES=nostrip too
Adds support for dedicated game servers (some packages do not provide clients and servers at the same time)
Adds DGA Support (Xfree86) (DGA=Direct Graphic Access)
Adds direct i/o support
Adds support for DirectFB layer (library for FB devices)
Adds extra documentation (API, Javadoc, etc)
Enable direct rendering: used for accelerated 3D and some 2D, like DMA
Enables libdts (DTS Coherent Acoustics decoder) support
Enables support for a codec used by many camcorders
Adds support for DVB (Digital Video Broadcasting)
Adds support for DVDs
Adds support for DVD writer hardware (e.g. in xcdroast)
Enables usage of Ogle's libdvdread for DVD playback
Enables support for Evolution-Data-Server(eds)
Adds support for GNU Emacs
Add support for Emacs/W3 where applicable
Adds support for the European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite
Adds support for the Empress database server
Adds local access support for the Empress database server
Pull in binary support libraries for x86 applications
Adds support for encoding of audio or video files
Adds support for media-sound/esound (Enlightened Sound Daemon)
Adds support for Easysoft OOD database
Adds support for ethereal wiretap log support in kismet
Assume Alpha processor is EV6 or better
Adds support for evolution in gnumeric and multisync
Install example source code
Adds support for reading EXIF headers from JPEG and TIFF images
Enable the use of dev-libs/expat
Enable FAM support
Add support for the FastCGI interface
Adds framebuffer support for the console, via the kernel
Add supports for Adobe's FDF toolkit.
Enable ffmpeg support
Use FFTW library for computing Fourier transforms
Adds support for filePro databases
Adds support for the Firebird relational database
Adds support for the flac audio codec
Adds support for creating flash files using Ming
Adds dbm support for flat files
Adds support for the foomatic printing driver database
Adds support for fortran (formally f77)
Adds support for the TDS protocol to connect to MSSQL/Sybase databases
Adds support for FreeWnn kana to kanji conversion engine
Adds support for the frontbase sql server
Adds FTP support
Adds support for Gnome Basic to gnumeric
Enable building with gcj
Adds support for media-libs/gd (to generate graphics on the fly)
Use the external version of gd rather than the bundled one (possibly dangerous)
Adds support for sys-libs/gdbm (GNU database libraries)
Add geoip support
Adds support for media-libs/libggi (non-X video api/drivers)
Adds GIF image support
Adds sci-mathematics/ginac (symbolic math) support
Build an OpenGL plugin using the GLUT library
Adds support for dev-libs/gmp (GNU MP library)
Adds GNOME support
Adds integration with GNUstep environment
Adds support for net-libs/gnutls
Adds digital camera support
Adds support for sys-libs/gpm (Console-based mouse driver)
Adds support for Global Positioning System
Adds support for media-libs/gstreamer (Streaming media)
Adds support for x11-libs/gtk+ (The GIMP Toolkit)
Use gtk+-2.0.0 over gtk+-1.2 in cases where a program supports both.
Adds support for gnome-extra/gtkhtml
Adds support for dev-util/guile (interpreter for Scheme)
Enable Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) support
activate default security enhancements for toolchain (gcc, glibc, binutils)
include the hardened php security patch for the php group of ebuilds
Enable howl support, enables DNS Service Discovery (DNS-SD)
Adds support for Hyperwave document storage system
Add support for IBM ppc64 specific systems
Add support for the Intel C++ Compiler (does _not_ set $CC)
Enable support for the iconv character set conversion library
Enable ICQ IM protocol support
Enable support for Internationalized Domain Names
Enable FireWire/iLink IEEE1394 support (dv, camera, ...)
use ifc instead of g77 to build
Enables support for Imagemagick (image converter)
Adds support for IMAP
Adds support for imlib, an image loading and rendering library
Adds support for Informix database
Adds support for Ingres database
Adds dbm support for .ini files
Adds innodb support for mySQL (transaction support)
Adds support for Interbase database
Adds support for iODBC library
Adds support for IP version 6
Enable jabber IM protocol support
Adds support for the JACK Audio Connection Kit
Adds support for Java
enable javascript support
Compile Java source code with jikes (faster)
Add support for joysticks in all packages
Adds JPEG image support
Adds junit awareness -- useful for developers.
Adds support for kde-base/kde (K Desktop Enviroment)
Makes kde ebuilds use the enable-final flag, yielding big compilation speedups at the cost of very heavy mem usage
Makes kde ebuilds download binary diffs rather than entire new tarballs for every new release
Adds kerberos support
Adds optional kerberos 4 compatibility support
Adds Linux Audio Developer's Configuration and Connection API support (LADCCA)
adds support for the virtual/lapack numerical library
Adds lcms support (color management engine)
Adds LDAP support (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol)
Adds input methods support to Emacs
Use lesstif over openmotif in cases where a program supports both
Add support for colored ASCII-art graphics
Use the libedit library (replacement for readline)
Adds C++ modules in dev-db/postgresql (libpq++)
Adds GNU Data Access (CORBA wrapper) support for gnumeric
Adds libwww support (General purpose WEB API)
Adds support for lirc (Linux's Infra-Red Remote Control)
!!internal use only!! DO NOT SET THIS FLAG YOURSELF!, used during livecd building.
Adds linux lm_sensors (hardware sensors) support
Enable Lua scripting support
Enable m17n-lib support
Adds support for mad (high-quality mp3 decoder library and cli frontend)
Adds support for maildir (~/.maildir) style mail spools
Adds mailwrapper support to allow multiple MTAs to be installed
Adds support for the matroska container format
Adds Matrox MGA support to mplayer
Adds support for mbox (/var/spool/mail) style mail spools
Adds support for MCAL calendar system
Support for the MCVE credit card payment system
Adds memory usage limiting in supporting programs
Adds support for the mhash library
enable migemo support for Japanese
Adds libmikmod support to allow playing of SoundTracker-style music files
Adds sendmail mail filter (milter) support
Adds MIME support
Adds support for ming library for creating flash format files
Install a very minimal build (disables, for example, plugins, fonts, most drivers, non-critical features)
Adds mmap support
Adds support for optimizations for Pentium MMX and Athlon class processors
Adds support for libmng (MNG images)
Adds support for the mnoGoSearch search engine
Build Mono bindings to support dotnet type stuff
Adds motif support (x11-libs/openmotif x11-libs/lesstif)
Adds mozilla support
Add support for reading mp3 files
Adds libmpeg3 support to various packages.
Adds MPI (Message Passing Interface) layer to the apps that support it.
Adds support for msession daemon
Enable MSN Messenger IM protocol support
Adds support for the MSQL database server
Adds support for Microsoft SQL Server database
Adds multi-language support to XEmacs
On 64bit systems, if you want to be able to compile 32bit and 64bit binaries
Adds mySQL support
Adds support for the improved mySQL libraries
Adds support for network audio sound
Adds ncurses support (console display library)
Enables network booting
Enable NetCDF data format support
Enable neXt toolkit
Use the nhc98 Haskell compiler instead of GHC if the package supports it
Support for NIS/YP services
Adds Native Language Support (using gettext - GNU locale utilities)
Tells emerge to install all files required to run the application without a CD mounted
Disable support for C++ (DONT USE THIS UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU'RE DOING)
Enable support for Native POSIX Threads Library, the new threading module (requires linux-2.6 or better usually)
Builds plugins for Netscape compatible browsers
Adds support/bindings for the Ocaml language
Adds Oracle 8 Support
Adds ODBC Support (Open DataBase Connectivity)
Enables potentially offensive items in packages
Enable support for importing (and exporting) OFX (Open Financial eXchange) data files
Adds support for the Ogg container format (commonly used by Vorbis, Theora and flac)
Adds support for the OggVorbis audio encoding - DEPRECATED useflag
Adds support for the Open Audio Library
Adds support for OpenGL
Adds support for Oracle 7
Enable oracle support
Enables support for Open Sound Control
Enable Oscar (AIM/ICQ) IM protocol support
Adds support for OSS (Open Sound System)
Adds support for the Ovrimos Database engine
Adds support PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) - DANGEROUS to arbitrarily flip
Adds support for PCMCIA slots/devices found on laptop computers
Adds support for process creation functions
Adds support for Perl Compatible Regular Expressions
Adds support for portable devices.
Adds support for PDF (Portable Document Format)
Adds support/bindings for the Perl language.
Adds support for Verisign Payflow Pro
Include support for php
Build Position Independent Code. Do not utilize this flag unless you know what you're doing.
Adds plotutils support to gnuplot (library for 2-D vector graphics)
Adds support for libpng (PNG images)
Adds support for the crossplatform portaudio audio API
Adds support for POSIX-compatible functions
Adds support for the postgresql database
Adds support for automatically generated ppd (printing driver) files
Adds support/bindings for the Prelude Intrusion Detection System
Adds profile support to builds of packages (will likely vary from ebuild to ebuild in support)
Adds support/bindings for the Python language
Adds support for the qdbm library
Adds support for the Qt library.
Adds support for OpenQuickTime
Adds support for RADIUS
enables support for libreadline, a GNU line-editing library that most everyone wants.
enables support for the GNU recode library
Adds support/bindings for the Ruby language
Adds support for SAMBA
Adds support for SAP DB
Adds support for the Simple Authentication and Security Layer
Adds support for scanner hardware (e.g. build the sane frontend in kdegraphics)
Adds support for Simple Direct Layer (media library)
!!internal use only!! Security Enhanced Linux support, this must be set by the selinux profile or breakage will occur
Adds persistent session support
Adds support for building shared extensions in php
Adds support for shared memory use
Adds support for the shorten audio compressor
support for simplexml
Enable S/Key (Single use password) authentication support
Adds support for the slang text display library (it's like ncurses, but different)
Adds Service Locator Protocol support to CUPS
Enables smartcard support
Adds support for libsndfile
Adds support for the Simple Network Management Protocol if available
Adds support for SOAP
Adds support for tcp/ip sockets
Adds support for the socks5 proxy
Adds support for the Solid database engine
Zip the sources and install them
Adds support for Sound eXchange (SoX)
Adds support for the speex audio codec
Adds dictionary support
Adds support for the Standard PHP Library
Adds support for sqlite - embedded sql database
fast floating point optimization for PentiumIII+ class chips
Adds support for Secure Socket Layer connections
!!do not set this during bootstrap!! Causes binaries to be statically linked instead of dynamically
Adds support for SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG ). This option is mainly intended for users that tend to browse multimedia sites frequently.
Adds support for SVGAlib (graphics library)
Adds support for the Sybase SQL Database Server
Adds support for Sybase-CT
Force kernel ebuilds to automatically update the /usr/src/linux symlink.
Support for System V-compatible inter-process communication
Use the szip compression library
Support for Tcl and/or Tk
Adds support for TCP wrappers
Work around to pull in packages needed to run with FEATURES=maketest / FEATURES=test
Adds support for teTeX
Adds support for the Theora Video Compression Codec
Adds threads support for various packages. Usually pthreads
Adds support for HTML Tidy
Adds support for the tiff image format
Adds support for the PHP file parser
Adds support for FreeType and/or FreeType2 fonts
Enable uclibc specific patches and build or link uclibc
Adds support for Unicode
Adds USB support to applications that have optional USB support (e.g. cups)
Enables video4linux support
Do not add extra patches which change default behaviour
Video CD support
effects vary across packages; generally used to enable extra informational output during a build or at runtime
Adds support for installing web-based applications into a virtual-hosting environment
Tells portage to install optional video files (used in some games)
Adds support for 3Dfx's Voodoo3 video chipset, else defaults to Voodoo4/5 support if not in USE.
Adds support for the OggVorbis audio codec
Adds support for WDDX
Enable wireless network functions
use win32codecs package for dll avi decoding support (wmv and what not)
Adds support for the wmf vector image format
Adds support for wxWindows/wxGTK
Adds xface support used to allow a small image of xface format to be included in an email via the header 'X-Face'.
Add support for the XINE movie libraries
Add support for the xinerama X11 extension, which allows you to stretch your display across multiple monitors
Check/Support flag for XML library (version 1)
Check/Support flag for XML library (version 2)
Support for xml-rpc library

Sends display using the X On Screen Display library
Support for XPM graphics format.
Support for xprint, http://www.mozilla.org/projects/xprint/
Check/Support flag for XSL library (version 1)

Adds support for xvid.org's open-source mpeg-4 codec
Enable Yahoo Messenger IM protocol support

package.name: festival
package.flag: adds a new command named tts_textasterisk that is required by net-misc/asterisk to communicate with the Festival server

package.name: gnome-speech
package.flag: Adds support for the freetts speech driver

package.name: gnopernicus
package.flag: Adds support for braille displays using brltty

package.name: apg
package.flag: Support for cracklib strong password checking

package.name: conky
package.flag: enable weather monitoring using the dev-libs/mdsplib library
include seti monitoring capabilities if the correct config is edited ~/.conkyrc

package.name: diradm
package.flag: Support for automount data in LDAP
Support for storing seperate IRIX passwords

package.name: lcap
package.flag: If you have the Linux Intrusion Detection System

package.name: testdisk
package.flag: Include the ability to read NTFS filesystems

package.name: torsmo
package.flag: include seti monitoring capabilities if the correct config is edited ~/.torsmorc

package.name: amanda
package.flag: Support for backing up raw XFS filesystems using xfsdump

package.name: bacula
package.flag: Disable DB support, and just build a client
Build console only bits, no gui
Disable DB support, and just build a client

package.name: boxbackup
package.flag: Disable server support, and just build a client

package.name: dar
package.flag: Enables --enable-mode=32 option, which replace infinint by 32 bits integers.
Enables --enable-mode=64 option, which replace infinint by 64 bits integers.

package.name: rdiff-backup
package.flag: if you want extended attributes enabled

package.name: cdrdao
package.flag: Use dev-util/pccts instead of the built-in substitution.

package.name: cdrtools
package.flag: On the fly AES encryption for CD-Rs.

package.name: disc-cover
package.flag: Enable audio CD support. This is not needed to make www-apps/disc-cover work.

package.name: k3b
package.flag: Enable support for MusicBrainz audio lookups (musicbrainz.org)

package.name: gringotts
package.flag: Install the binary suid, acknowledging the usual risks

package.name: johntheripper
package.flag: enables john to crack Windows NT/2000 MD4 (case-sensitive) password hashes

package.name: emacs
package.flag: If you do not want to install any MTA

package.flag: Include support for the Aqua / Carbon GUI
Include support for the mzscheme interpreter
Include support for the neXtaw GUI
Use libtermcap-compat rather than ncurses (not generally recommended)

package.flag: Use libtermcap-compat rather than ncurses (not generally recommended)

package.flag: Include support for the mzscheme interpreter
Use libtermcap-compat rather than ncurses (not generally recommended)
Link console vim against X11 libraries to enable title and clipboard features in xterm

package.flag: Chooses the MIT Athena widget set
Enables support for the x11-libs/dnd drag-n-drop library

package.name: emul-linux-x86-glibc
package.flag: Disables installing the linuxthreads fallback in glibc ebuilds that support building both linuxthreads and nptl.

package.name: mol
package.flag: Support for the sheep net driver

package.name: point2play

package.name: atokx2

Enable immodule for Qt support (binary compatible)

package.flag: Enable indexing of MS HTML Help files (.chm)

package.name: booh
package.flag: Use transcode to extract video thumbnails

package.name: note

package.name: screen

Use UTF8 encoding instead of LATIN1.

package.name: postgresql

Adds in the vacuum inter-page delay feature.

package.name: gnustep-make
package.flag: Layout GNUstep according to /etc/conf.d/gnustep.env; GNUSTEP_SYSTEM_ROOT, GNUSTEP_LOCAL_ROOT, GNUSTEP_NETWORK_ROOT, and GNUSTEP_USER_ROOT (use '~' or '~/whatever' -- SURROUNDED BY SINGLE QUOTES -- for the user root); the only required entry is GNUSTEP_SYSTEM_ROOT; GNUSTEP_SYSTEM_ROOT must end with "System".
Layout GNUstep FHS like OSX's (violates Linux FHS, but arguably more NeXT-like); User, Local, Network, and System are set to (in order): "~", "/", "/Network", "/System"
do not flatten launch and library paths for GNUstep packages allowing executable within a .app to be launched based on processor type

package.name: sitecopy
package.flag: Enables GSSAPI (Generic Security Services Application Programming Interface). This is a client-server authentication method that promotes a standard API for authentication systems. This is included in kerbos distributions and allows vendors to define a specific system with a more generic API layer to coordinate with other authentication systems.
This allows the use of rsh (remote shell) and rcp (remote copy) for authoring websites. sftp is a much more secure protocol and is prefered.
Enables use of sftp for secure ftp transfers.

package.name: tinylogin
package.flag: Create all the appropriate symlinks in /bin and /sbin

package.name: util-linux
package.flag: build support for the older cryptoapi that earlier util-linux's included

package.name: arcboot
package.flag: Disables support for Cobalt Microserver hardware (Qube2/RaQ2)
Disables support for SGI Indigo2 Impact R10000 (IP28)

package.name: lilo
package.flag: Avoid character echo on PXE serial console

package.name: yaboot-static
package.flag: Indicate the usage of ibm based ppc64 hardware

package.name: yaboot
package.flag: Indicate the usage of ibm based ppc64 hardware

package.name: charm
package.flag: Enable direct SMP support using shared memory
Use TCP (instead of UPD) for socket communication

package.name: heartbeat
package.flag: Adds support for ldiretord, use enabled because it has a lot of deps
Adds support for a generalized plugin and interface loading system

package.name: lam-mpi
package.flag: Add support for PBS scheduling stuff

package.name: torque
package.flag: Use SCP instead of RCP for copying files between machines.

package.name: binutils
package.flag: Allow for multiple versions of binutils to be emerged at once for same CTARGET
Adds support to binutils for cross compiling (does not work with gas)

package.name: distcc
package.flag: Change distcc-config to create shell script not links for proper invokation on cross compile setups

package.name: gcc-mips64
package.flag: Enable building a compiler capable of building a kernel for SGI Indigo2 Impact R10000 (IP28)

package.name: gcc
package.flag: Enable building a compiler capable of building a kernel for SGI Indigo2 Impact R10000 (IP28)
Allow for SLOTs to include minor version (3.3.4 instead of just 3.3)
Enable n32 ABI support on mips
Enable n64 ABI support on mips
Disable PIE support (NOT FOR GENERAL USE)
Disable SSP support (NOT FOR GENERAL USE)
Build support for the Objective C code language
Build support for the Objective C code language Garbage Collector

package.name: libperl
package.flag: Enable Perl threads, has some compatibility problems

package.name: clvm
package.flag: Allow users to build clvm without cman support and with gulm support

package.name: loop-aes
package.flag: Protects the encryption key in memory but takes more cpu resources

package.name: lvm2
package.flag: Allow users to build lvm2 dynamically

package.name: genkernel
package.flag: Installs bootsplash support if you request it and it is not already available.
Install IBM pSeries config as default instead of G5 config.

package.name: gentoo-sources
package.flag: If you have a SUN Ultra 1 with a HME interface

package.name: mips-headers
package.flag: Enables support for Cobalt Microserver hardware (Qube2/RaQ2)

package.name: mips-sources
package.flag: Enables support for Cobalt Microserver hardware (Qube2/RaQ2)
Enables support for SGI Indigo2 Impact R10000 (IP28)

package.name: sparc-sources
package.flag: If you have a SUN Ultra 1 with a HME interface

package.name: suspend2-sources
package.flag: If you have a SUN Ultra 1 with a HME interface

package.name: vserver-sources
package.flag: Adds experimental NGNET patches by Herbert Poetzl (http://vserver.13thfloor.at/Experimental/NGNET/)

package.name: glibc
package.flag: Enable erandom/frandom support in glibc for ssp
Configure glibc with --enable-omitfp which lets the build system determine when it is safe to use -fomit-frame-pointer

Configure the linuxthreads glibc with --with-__thread if supported by your system. --with-tls is always enabled if supported and is NOT controlled by this switch. So the glibc built will always support TLS binaries. This toggle chooses whether or not glibc itself uses TLS. If you're concerned about backwards compatibility with old binaries, leave this off.
Enable n32 ABI support on mips
Enable n64 ABI support on mips
default to not performing some sanity checks that prevent and detect data corruption. this removes the small overhead introduced by the check.
Disables building the linuxthreads fallback in glibc ebuilds that support building both linuxthreads and nptl.
build only the locales specified in /etc/locales.build

package.name: pam
package.flag: Builds the pam_chroot module (enables per-user chroots at login)
Builds the pam_console module (enables per-user device permissions for console user)
Builds the pam_timestamp module (enables recent successful attempt authentication)
If you want pam_pwdb.so installed to use pwdb as passwd db

package.name: uclibc
package.flag: build uclibc with backwards compatible options
build only the locales specified in /etc/locales.build

package.name: cpufreqd
package.flag: Enable for nforce2 voltage settings plug-in

package.name: procps
package.flag: Enable n32 ABI support on mips

package.name: mod_suphp
package.flag: Check if script resides in DOCUMENT_ROOT
Run scripts with UID/GID specified in Apache configuration
Run scripts with owner UID/GID but also check if they match the UID/GID specified in the Apache configuration

package.name: dspam-web
package.flag: Build with delivery options for exim
Builds for large domain rather than for domain scale
Build with delivery options for maildrop

package.name: horde-passwd
package.flag: Enables cleartext password storage in the vpopmail files

package.name: open-xchange
package.flag: Enable WebDav (Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning) support.

package.name: swish-e
package.flag: enable support for exporting to pdf

package.name: trac
package.flag: Add enscript support to colourize code stored in the repository
Add SilverCity support to colourize code stored in the repository

package.flag: Add cvsgraph support to show graphical views of revisions and branches
Add enscript support to colourize code stored in the repository

package.name: websvn
package.flag: Add enscript support to colourize code stored in the repository

package.name: elinks
package.flag: Enable support for the finger protocol
Enable support for the gopher protocol

package.name: epiphany
package.flag: build against firefox instead of mozilla

package.flag: build against firefox instead of mozilla

package.flag: enable estraier support for full-text search in history.

package.name: kazehakase
package.flag: enable estraier support for full-text search in history.

package.name: mozilla-firefox
package.flag: Enable features for web developers (e.g. Venkman)
Disable XFT support in mozilla (also firefox, thunderbird)
Enable SVG support in mozilla and firefox

package.name: mozilla
package.flag: Enable features for web developers (e.g. Venkman)
Disable building of mozilla's HTML editor component
Disable building of mozilla's IRC client
Disable XFT support in mozilla (also firefox, thunderbird)
Enable SVG support in mozilla and firefox

package.flag: If you want to link imlib2 instead of imlib against w3mimgdisplay
If you prefer Lynx-like key binding

if you want extended attributes enabled

package.name: pound
package.flag: if you want the Microsoft DAV extensions enabled
if you want the 'unsafe' characters passed through to the web servers

package.name: shttpd
package.flag: Enable debugging with the dmalloc library

package.name: skunkweb
package.flag: enable apache1 support if internal server and apache2 support not wanted

package.name: thttpd
package.flag: Create phpconfig source tarball (for maintainer use only)

package.flag: Installs DRM built to work alongside GATOS features

package.name: xorg-x11
package.flag: Builds the crappy 100 DPI and 75 DPI fonts
Enable dynamic module loader instead of ELF loader
Build XFS, the X Font Server
Builds insecure DRI stuff for via, mach64 and savage

package.name: fltk
package.flag: Disables fltk; use for non-english characters

package.name: libXfont
package.flag: Support the crappy 100 DPI and 75 DPI fonts
Support CID fonts -- non-Roman character sets
Support Speedo fonts, an old type of font

package.name: qt
package.flag: Enable binary incompatible version of immodule for Qt
Enable binary compatible version of immodule for Qt

package.name: wxGTK
package.flag: Disable gtk support. Must be used in combination with gtk2
Add gtk1 support in addition to optional gtk2ansi and gtk2unicode

package.name: linuxwacom
package.flag: Installs dynamically linked linuxwacom Xorg driver
Builds wacom X11 driver against installed X11 SDK

package.name: synaptics
package.flag: Installs dynamically linked synaptics Xorg driver

package.name: vnc2swf
package.flag: Install script that depends on x11vnc

package.name: xlockmore
package.flag: Enables xlockrc for people without PAM

package.flag: Installs some screensaver modules as setuid root to enable cooler effects
Enables users to create new logins even if the X screen is locked by someone else

package.name: wmsysmon
package.flag: Enable support for monitoring 24 interrupts, useful on SMP machines

package.flag: Enable resources via X instead of aterm small version

package.flag: Enable the xterm toolbar to be built.

package.flag: Don't include the standard E themes
Enable support for the X xrandr extension

package.name: fluxbox
package.flag: Force the supplied themes to use at least 10pt fonts

package.name: icewm
package.flag: Apply ybuttons.cc.patch necessary for SilverXP theme

package.name: windowmaker
package.flag: Enable XKB language status lock support. README says: "If you don't know what it is you probably don't need it."
